TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed CacheItemPriority extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies a priority setting that is used to decide whether to evict a cache entry.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The only priority that can be set is whether an entry should remain in the cache forever.
> [!IMPORTANT] > Adding an entry to the cache with a priority level of NotRemovable has the potential to overflow the cache with entries that can never be removed. Cache implementations should only set the NotRemovable priority for a cache entry if they provide ways to evict such entries from the cache and to manage the number of cache entries.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPriority Default = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that there is no priority for removing the cache entry.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPriority NotRemovable = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Indicates that a cache entry should never be removed from the cache.
